product_name: EucerinRadiant Tone Night Cream Dark Spot Corrector
summary: SummaryEucerin Radiant Tone Night Cream Dark Spot Corrector works through the night to help visibly reduce the look of dark spots and help restore skin's radiance.
details: DetailsBenefitsHelps minimize the look of persistent dark spots due to sun exposure, aging and imperfectionsRegular use of this dark spot corrector helps maintain even-looking skinFeaturesNon-sticky facial moisturizerSuitable night moisturizer for all skin types, even sensitive skinKey IngredientsFormula with Thiamidol helps minimize the look of persistent dark spots due to sun exposure, aging and imperfectionsItem 2634617How To UseMassage Eucerin Radiant Tone Night Cream Dark Spot Corrector into your face and neck every night. Limit the collective use of Radiant Tone skincare products to four times daily.Precautions: Keep out of reach of children. For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Discontinue use if irritation occurs.IngredientsWater, Glycerin, Alcohol Denat., Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Squalane, Cetearyl Isononanoate, Panthenol, Isopropyl Palmitate, Glyceryl Stearate Citrate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Hydrogenated Coco-Glycerides, Methylpropanediol, Lauroyl Lysine, Tocopherol, Isobutylamido Thiazolyl Resorcinol, Glucosylrutin, Pantolactone, Glycyrrhiza Inflata Root Extract, Isoquercitrin, Distarch Phosphate, Xanthan Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Citric Acid, Fragrance.
how_to_use: Massage Eucerin Radiant Tone Night Cream Dark Spot Corrector into your face and neck every night. Limit the collective use of Radiant Tone skincare products to four times daily.Precautions: Keep out of reach of children. For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Discontinue use if irritation occurs.

reviews.headline: Eucerin night cream
reviews.comments: This night cream makes my skin very hydrated and glowly. It has a cooling sensation when you put it on your face. Makes my skin feel smooth and soft .

reviews.headline: Works, but drying
reviews.comments: Easy to apply, absorbed well, & the 'lotiony' smell wasn't overpowering. It worked well for the price & lightened quite a few of my acne scars. However, it caused dry / rough patches on sensitive areas when it transferred (nose, around my lips, undereye). I recommend giving it a try, but it's just not for me.

reviews.headline: Works, but very scented
reviews.comments: I'm sensitive to scents (perfume, hair products, etc) & this borders on too smelly, like perfumed sunscreen. It does fade my dark spots though. Try it, but be aware of the scent.

reviews.headline: Will keep using/buying
reviews.comments: Been using for about 2 weeks and already see a lightening of the age/sun spots on my face. Don't like harsh acids so opted for this more gentle product and so far so good.

reviews.headline: Too Fragrant
reviews.comments: I beg of brands to intro fragrance free versions of things because while the feel of this is nice it smells like my tub cleaner. One night and I'm gagging. If you're sensitive to fragrance this is not a win.

reviews.headline: impressed
reviews.comments: I've only used this once so far but I'm impressed. It calmed down some redness, made my skin look really hydrated, and even made my skin look a little brighter.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I've been using the Eucerin Radiant Tone Night Cream Dark Spot Corrector for a few weeks now, and overall, I'm really impressed with the results! The texture is lightweight, absorbs well into the skin, and doesn't feel greasy or heavy overnight. I've noticed a visible improvement in my skin tone, with some of my dark spots appearing lighter and my complexion looking more even.

One of the things I appreciate most is that it doesn't cause irritation, which is a huge plus for my skin. It's also fragrance-free, making it great for sensitive skin types. However, I do think it requires consistent, long-term use to see the full effect on stubborn dark spots. It's not an overnight miracle, but with patience, it delivers results.

The only slight downside is that it may not be hydrating enough for drier skin types, so I pair it with a good moisturizer. Otherwise, it's a solid product that I'd recommend to anyone looking for a gentle yet effective dark spot corrector!
faceoff_positive.headline: 4.6/5 Stars

faceoff_negative.comments: The feeling and the texture of this product is really nice. I have been using it for like 4 days and I just cant anymore. It smells so much like perfume which I was not expecting from Eucerin. A lot of their products seem theyare geared towards sensitive skin. I don't mind fragrance in skincare I wouldn't say I love it but it isn't a deal breaker for me if the product works good but this smells like straight up perfume and it's strong and lasts on my face. I even washed my hands like 4 times before I couldn't smell it anymore after applying. I don't want my face to smell like perfume I like more clean spa like scents. It's disappointing. Face products shouldn't have scents in them anyway like I really don't understand why people want their face to smell like bottles of perfume like more expensive  department store brands it's horrible.
faceoff_negative.headline: It's a no
